subject: Moved the common code and functions between fru deamons in entitymanager.
commitMessage:
Moved the common code and functions between
fru deamons in entitymanager.

Store the common functions/variable declarations
between multiple fru related deamons in the
FruUtils.cpp and FruUtils.hpp files in entitymanager.

TESTED : Built Facebook YosemiteV2 images and loaded
on the target hardware. Verified all the fru's read and write.

Signed-off-by: Kumar Thangavel <thangavel.k@hcl.com>
Change-Id: I42129998603915af7a81f2bb8dff39dc198e8264

comments.message: Uploaded patch set 1.

2 patchsets are doing very similar things:

https://gerrit.openbmc-project.xyz/c/openbmc/entity-manager/+/39291

Can you discuss between the two of you and make sure that we can meet both your needs?

> Patch Set 2:
> 
> 2 patchsets are doing very similar things:
> 
> https://gerrit.openbmc-project.xyz/c/openbmc/entity-manager/+/39291
> 
> Can you discuss between the two of you and make sure that we can meet both your needs?

Sure. I will discuss with Patrick Venture. 

Thanks.

Patch Set 2:

Hi Patrick Venture,

I have submitted patch for adding support to read/write FRU details through the ipmb interface.
Created the new deamon "ipmb-fru-device" similar to fru-device in entity-manager to handle this patch.

Please find the below patches for more details.
https://gerrit.openbmc-project.xyz/c/openbmc/entity-manager/+/39593
https://gerrit.openbmc-project.xyz/c/openbmc/entity-manager/+/39592
https://gerrit.openbmc-project.xyz/c/openbmc/meta-phosphor/+/37513

Please let us know if you are also working on the similar feature. We can discuss and meet our requirements. 

Thanks.

Patch Set 2:

> Patch Set 2:
> 
> Hi Patrick Venture,
> 
> I have submitted patch for adding support to read/write FRU details through the ipmb interface.
> Created the new deamon "ipmb-fru-device" similar to fru-device in entity-manager to handle this patch.
> 
> Please find the below patches for more details.
> https://gerrit.openbmc-project.xyz/c/openbmc/entity-manager/+/39593
> https://gerrit.openbmc-project.xyz/c/openbmc/entity-manager/+/39592
> https://gerrit.openbmc-project.xyz/c/openbmc/meta-phosphor/+/37513
> 
> Please let us know if you are also working on the similar feature. We can discuss and meet our requirements. 
> 
> Thanks.

My goal is actually to make the utility methods on data work without boost, so I can recompile it and use it elsewhere -- and add tests more easily.  By putting all the "utility" code together in a common file, it then gains generality and loses specificity and then I can't use it without a lot of regex to erase the parts I don't want.

By putting all the "utility" code together in a common file, it then gains generality and loses specificity and then I can't use it without a lot of regex to erase the parts I don't want.

I went through your change and if you renamed it (or just rebase on my patch which is on another patch) that problem is solved.  Also, I went through and most of your headers aren't used.  The code at face value is fairly straightforward and I should be able to use it, and someone can write tests for it - perhaps you?

I believe I requested that you rebase on top of my patch, and here's why - it handles one of my comments that you rename the common.hpp to something specific, and your CL moves some of the related code, but not actually the code in my CL - which would make sense to include in a separate library that's abstracted away from the business logic.

Done
typo.
Done
Why did this get moved?  This seems like an odd api to need in a generic FRU library.
+1 seems this is I2C specific. I'd say it should be reimplemented as callback to bus-specific daemon.

This function is used in the below patch which is used to read/write FRU data using ipmb interface.
https://gerrit.openbmc-project.xyz/c/openbmc/entity-manager/+/39593
Because of this reason, I have moved to FruUtils.cpp as common for all the FRU deamons.
Do you really need to check for "isMuxBus" in ipmbFruDevice? How does it work?
Agree. Not needed in the ipmbFruDevice. I will move this function to FruDevice.cpp
could we move this I2C specific functions back to "i2cFruDevice"?
